Metadata: Simulated salt marshes: methods for reducing experimental error
"Wetland and Riparian Ecosystems of the American West, " Proceedings of the Eighth Annual Meeting of the Society of Wetland Scientists, pp. 315-317, Seattle, Washington, May 26-29, 1987.

The dynamic nature of southern California salt marshes complicates prolonged field experiments. To create a more predictable system for manipulative experiments, the authors constructed artificial salt marsh mesocosms at an outdoor laboratory. Construction, maintenance, and applications are reviewed.
